description: In what could be a wonderful holiday for the Linux desktop, it looks like the Wayland color management protocol might finally be close to merging after four years in discussion...
title: Wayland Color Management Protocol Might Finally Be Close To Merging

description: As an alternative to the GNOME System Monitor application for system monitoring, Resources has been in development as a currently unofficial, GNOME-aligned resource/hardware monitoring application written in the Rust programming language. Resources v1.7 was released on Friday and now has the ability to monitor NPU usage and other enhancements...
title: Resources System Monitoring App For GNOME Now Displays NPU Usage

description: In addition to the USB updates and big staging flush merged yesterday for the Linux 6.13 kernel merge window, the "char/misc" pull was also honored for that catch-all of various kernel changes. With the char/misc pull there are some notable additions for those wanting to write kernel drivers within the Rust programming language...
title: Linux 6.13 Hits A "Tipping Point" With More Rust Drivers Expected Soon

description: The Rust Hypervisor Firmware is a project out of the Cloud Hypervisor umbrella for developing open-source, Rust-based firmware that can be launched from any environment able to load ELF binaries and run them via the PVH booting standard. Rust Hypervisor Firmware v0.5 is out this weekend with the newest capabilities...
title: Rust Hypervisor Firmware v0.5 Supports For More CPUs & Improves EFI Support

description: KDE developers have wrapped up a busy November with many fixes and other refinements landing this last week of the month...
title: KDE Ends November With More KWin Fixes & Other Polishing Ahead Of Plasma 6.3
